inlineContent.text: Number of request attempts before throwing an error. Must be between 1 and 10. Default value is 3.

A placement is a specific location within a user’s journey (such as onboarding, settings, etc.) where its internal paywall is intended to be displayed. See documentation for details: https://docs.apphud.com/docs/placements.
In case of network issues this method may return empty array. To get the possible error use

abstract.text: Asynchronously retrieves the paywall placements configured in Product Hub > Placements, potentially altered based on the user’s involvement in A/B testing, if any. Awaits until the inner
s are loaded from the App Store.
Retrieves an array of existing
objects or fetches products from the App Store that have been added in the Apphud Dashboard under Product Hub > Products.
Initiates the purchase of an
object from an
and optionally from
and automatically submits the App Store Receipt to Apphud.
Retrieves the view controller for the Screen that is pending presentation. This screen is usually triggered by a pending Rule in Apphud. You have the option to present this Screen manually or use the
method.
Increments a custom user property. Value must be one of:
or
Checks the eligibility for introductory offers for multiple products simultaneously.
Submits the device’s push token to Apphud. This is essential for enabling Apphud to send push notifications to the device.
Logs a “Paywall Shown” event which is required for A/B Testing analytics.
Checks if the user has an active non-renewing purchase with a specific product identifier. This includes consumables, non-consumables, or non-renewing subscriptions.
Grants a free promotional subscription to the user. This method updates the user’s subscription status, and after this, the
method will return
Retrieves the most recently purchased auto-renewable subscription object for the current user. Subscriptions are cached on the device.
Checks the eligibility for promotional offers for multiple products simultaneously.
Submits attribution data to Apphud
Disables automatic paywall and placement requests during the SDK’s initial setup. Developers must explicitly call
or
methods at a later point in the app’s lifecycle to fetch placements with inner paywalls.
Checks whether the given product is eligible for any of its promotional offers.
Fetches
objects asynchronously from the App Store. This method is used to retrieve the products that you have configured in the Apphud dashboard (Apphud > Product Hub > Products).
Retrieves an
object based on its product identifier. This method is used to access product details for items you’ve added in the Apphud Dashboard under Product Hub > Products.
Retrieves all auto-renewable subscriptions that the user has ever purchased. This method is useful if your app has more than one subscription group.
Determines whether the user currently has premium access, either through an active auto-renewable subscription, non-renewing subscription or a non-consumable (lifetime) purchase.
Fetches a paywall screen and returns it as a SwiftUI view ready for presentation.
Checks whether the given product is eligible for an introductory offer, which includes
, or
options.
Fetches raw receipt information in an ApphudReceipt model class. This is useful for accessing details like the original_application_version.

A list of paywall placements, potentially altered based on the user’s involvement in A/B testing, if any. A placement is a specific location within a user’s journey (such as onboarding, settings, etc.) where its internal paywall is intended to be displayed.
Presents an Apphud Screen that was previously delayed for presentation. This is typically used in conjunction with the
delegate method, where returning
would delay the Screen’s presentation.

Returns the current device ID. Use this method if you need to implement a custom logout/login flow by saving a User ID & Device ID pair for each app user. This allows for a more controlled management of user sessions and device associations.
Returns the current userID that identifies the user across multiple devices.
Refreshes current user data including paywalls, placements, subscriptions, non-renewing purchases, and promotionals.
Initializes Apphud SDK. Call this during the app’s launch.
Notifies Apphud when a purchase process is initiated from a paywall in
, enabling the use of A/B experiments. This method should be called right before executing your own purchase method, and it’s specifically required only when the SDK is in Observer Mode.
Retrieves an array of
objects that were added in the Apphud dashboard (Apphud > Product Hub > Products). This property returns
if the products have not been fetched from the App Store yet.
Preloads and caches one or more paywall screens to enable faster presentation.
Implements the
mechanism. This method sends the current App Store Receipt to Apphud and returns information about the user’s subscriptions and in-app purchases.
A placement is a specific location within a user’s journey (such as onboarding, settings, etc.) where its internal paywall is intended to be displayed.
Web-to-Web flow only. Attempts to attribute the user with the provided attribution data.
If the
parameter contains either
or
, the SDK will submit this information to the Apphud server.
The server will return a restored web user if found; otherwise, the callback will return
Checks if the user has an active premium auto-renewable subscription.
Updates the user ID. Use this when you need to change the user identifier during the app’s runtime.
s
Handles an incoming push notification payload. This method is used to process Rules-related notifications created by Apphud.
Removes the preloaded paywall Screen from memory cache.
Purchases a subscription with a promotional offer and automatically submits the App Store Receipt to Apphud.
Retrieves the base64-encoded App Store receipt string, if available.
Initializes Apphud SDK with User ID & Device ID pair. Not recommended for use unless you know what you are doing.
Asynchronously retrieve a specific placement by identifier configured in Product Hub > Placements, potentially altered based on the user’s involvement in A/B testing, if any. Awaits until the inner
s are loaded from the App Store.
Logs out the current user, clears all saved data, and resets the SDK to an uninitialized state. After calling this method, you must reinitialize the SDK with
or
for a new user.
Asynchronously fetches a paywall Screen for the given paywall.
Asynchronously retrieves the paywall placements configured in Product Hub > Placements, potentially altered based on the user’s involvement in A/B testing, if any. Awaits until the inner
s are loaded from the App Store.
Sets a custom user property in Apphud. The value assigned to this property must be of one of the following types:
, or
Retrieves the placements configured in Product Hub > Placements, potentially altered based on the user’s involvement in A/B testing, if any. Awaits until the inner
s are loaded from the App Store.
Submits Device Identifiers (IDFA and IDFV) to Apphud. These identifiers may be required for marketing and attribution platforms such as AppsFlyer, Facebook, Singular, etc.
Apphud is an all-in-one infrastructure for your app growth. Apphud helps marketing and product management teams make the right decisions based on data and tools.
Restores the user’s purchases asynchronously. This method should be called when the user taps the “Restore” button in your app.
Retrieves all non-renewing purchases (consumables, non-consumables, or non-renewing subscriptions) made by the user. Purchases are cached on the device and sorted by purchase date.
Retrieves the Apphud Rule associated with a Screen that was delayed for presentation.
This method sends all user properties immediately to Apphud. Should be used for audience segmentation in placements based on user properties.
